title: >>> I 17
body_text:
What better way to kick off the second half of Season 9 than with this blockbuster. It's
2005 vs. 2007
in a match that pits not only two outstanding,
young
athletes, but two fearless, all-around gifted competitors to
ever
grace the dodgeball court.
The one and only
Kevin Adams
looks to take down another 17 year-old sensation in rising headliner
Grant Cornero
.
Whether it was the Ocean Road Park era or the modern-day wars of Wall High School, Kevin Adams has unquestionably left an indelible mark on this sport. A man of "firsts" if you will: the first "Act of Courage" Award winner, an accolade presented at DODGEBALL 20; participated in
and
won the first officially recognized team battle in history at DODGEBALL 50. If those aren't enough, it wasn't long ago he was "creamating" one Lenny Herrera in the first-ever
CREAMation Rules
match at the inaugural event of Season 9. An overall record of 5 wins and 2 losses, it's a career that never seems to fade. Few, perhaps none, have reached the heights of this megastar.
Fast Fact!
Remember the days when Kevin nursed a cast on his left wrist? Unbeknownst to a majority of his dodgeball peers, Grant has partaken in the weekly extravaganzas with a broken finger! Ahh, the irony of it all.
Anyone who has suffered any bodily injury, whether on the court or off it, and still competes, has earned respect and admiration the hard way. Grant is all about no fear, conquering the greats of the game, and cementing his name as an impact player in the process. Veterans and newblood alike have taken notice at this major star who has one hell of an opportunity at DODGEBAL LXXXVI. There isn't anyone better suited for the job than the multi-talented Kevin Adams to go up against.
Will Kevin's past knowledge and experience lead him to a 6th victory?
Will Grant rise to the occasion in his tryout match?
One of the most unpredictable matches ever!
Do not miss
2005 vs. 2007
!
**MORE TO COME!**
Check
dodgeball.livejournal.com
this Friday as some of the game's brightest speak up and out about this epic encounter.
DODGEBALL 87
"It's time to play the Feud!" Off-court titans, and sisters, go head to head in one of dodgeball's most unexpected matches of the modern era. The elder
Liz Nogueira
faces
Kathryn Nogueira
come May 12.
DODGEBALL 88
Unbeaten dodging experts collide! The iconic "crazy"
Mike Edwards
looks to mirror his performance at DODGEBALL 80 when he takes on the equally impressive and a legend in his own right,
Mike Butler
. Whose streak ends May 19?
DODGEBALL 89
Could it be the most anticipated return to the captains circle? The man, the myth, the legend
Dan Spengeman
returns to action for one night only. It's "QuickSand" versus a mystery opponent on May 26.
Check back next week following the conclusion of DODGEBALL LXXXVI for an earth-shattering announcement regarding DODGEBALL 90!
body_html:
What better way to kick off the second half of Season 9 than with this blockbuster. It's 2005 vs. 2007 in a match that pits not only two outstanding, young athletes, but two fearless, all-around gifted competitors to ever grace the dodgeball court.

The one and only Kevin Adams looks to take down another 17 year-old sensation in rising headliner Grant Cornero.

Whether it was the Ocean Road Park era or the modern-day wars of Wall High School, Kevin Adams has unquestionably left an indelible mark on this sport. A man of "firsts" if you will: the first "Act of Courage" Award winner, an accolade presented at DODGEBALL 20; participated in and won the first officially recognized team battle in history at DODGEBALL 50. If those aren't enough, it wasn't long ago he was "creamating" one Lenny Herrera in the first-ever CREAMation Rules match at the inaugural event of Season 9. An overall record of 5 wins and 2 losses, it's a career that never seems to fade. Few, perhaps none, have reached the heights of this megastar.

Fast Fact! Remember the days when Kevin nursed a cast on his left wrist? Unbeknownst to a majority of his dodgeball peers, Grant has partaken in the weekly extravaganzas with a broken finger! Ahh, the irony of it all.

Anyone who has suffered any bodily injury, whether on the court or off it, and still competes, has earned respect and admiration the hard way. Grant is all about no fear, conquering the greats of the game, and cementing his name as an impact player in the process. Veterans and newblood alike have taken notice at this major star who has one hell of an opportunity at DODGEBAL LXXXVI. There isn't anyone better suited for the job than the multi-talented Kevin Adams to go up against.

Will Kevin's past knowledge and experience lead him to a 6th victory?
Will Grant rise to the occasion in his tryout match?

One of the most unpredictable matches ever!
Do not miss 2005 vs. 2007!


**MORE TO COME!**
Check dodgeball.livejournal.com this Friday as some of the game's brightest speak up and out about this epic encounter.


DODGEBALL 87
"It's time to play the Feud!" Off-court titans, and sisters, go head to head in one of dodgeball's most unexpected matches of the modern era. The elder Liz Nogueira faces Kathryn Nogueira come May 12.

DODGEBALL 88
Unbeaten dodging experts collide! The iconic "crazy" Mike Edwards looks to mirror his performance at DODGEBALL 80 when he takes on the equally impressive and a legend in his own right, Mike Butler. Whose streak ends May 19?

DODGEBALL 89
Could it be the most anticipated return to the captains circle? The man, the myth, the legend Dan Spengeman returns to action for one night only. It's "QuickSand" versus a mystery opponent on May 26.

Check back next week following the conclusion of DODGEBALL LXXXVI for an earth-shattering announcement regarding DODGEBALL 90!
